item.title: [Release] Zamorak Chestplate [Release]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“shrogg, post:21, topic:332269”]yeah, im wondering the same thing.
because i want to animate my platebody i made for the comp :P[/quote]

what i do is open a platebody in datmaker, and look at its animation data
you have to clone your platebody 3 times and make the other clones with the names of(in order)
PRI:
TSKIN:
VSKIN1:

in datmaker at the top you would click the pri box, and it will show all the priorities values, in meta you take the model named PRI: and set a material with whatever number is in it (you have to load masterpallete to have all these colors)
same thing with tskin
with vskin you have to select the number of points have data in the VSKIN1 model, and then click the Wgt tool, and set it to 0.## the ## being whatever vskin value is for those points.

theres a tut by mr.potatohead somewhere around here on adding animation

Read full topic

item.title: [Release] Zamorak Chestplate [Release]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

If you read the topic title right, you will already know this is a topic on my Zamorak Platebody, i have based this model for all compatibility with the rs client. Therefore the model will not be full of detail, but i did manage to make it look good and only using 606 triangles

After i animate and get all the ints right, i do plan on releasing the platebody

Now that thats all said and done, on with the screenshots!

[b][size=16pt]Front View

Back View [/size]

Like i said before, after i get everything nice and proper, i plan on releasing the platebody model so keep checking the topic.

P.S: soon i will probably work on some platelegs or skirt to go with the platebody.

[center][size=14pt]-------Now for the Release!------------[/size][/center]

The model is now 100% animated and ready to be added to your client!
Just add these ints to your client and download the models and your all set!

        if(i == 12600)
        {
            class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
            class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
            class8.anInt174 = 50002;
            class8.anInt181 = 984;
            class8.anInt190 = 500;
            class8.anInt204 = 0;
            class8.anInt198 = 2039;
            class8.anInt199 = 0;
            class8.anInt169 = 0;
            class8.anInt194 = 0;
            class8.anInt165 = 50001;
            class8.anInt200 = 50001;
            class8.anInt164 = 50000;
            class8.anInt188 = 50000;
            class8.anInt175 = -1;
            class8.aBoolean176 = false;
            class8.aString170 = "Zamorak Chestplate";
            class8.aByteArray178 = "A sturdy chest plate.".getBytes();
        }

NOTE: The model ids are 50000+, if you havent increased your model array to allow you to add higher model ids, you might want to lower the model ids in the ints to your liking.

I have Gzipped a set of models for packing ready, and left a set in .dats for people who like preloading.

Read full topic
